Description:
The Oracle Database Administrator will :
Monitor and analyze database performance and ensure effective and efficient utilization of database and issues troubleshooting systems/processes.
Participate in the development and maintenance of strategic, architectural, and tactical plans for the database and data warehouse environment.
Provide individual mentoring and training on databases and tools. Recommend, test, and evaluate new technologies, software tools, and required skill sets.
Implement a Business Continuity solution for the database environment, including the installation and configuration of database software and replication processes.
Installing and Administering Oracle Database 11g, 12c, and 19c on "Oracle Enterprise Linux, Redhat, CentOS, AIX, and Solaris".
Users Maintenance (creation & assigning roles & Privs. & Other security features).
Monitor, Optimize & Performance tuning of Production Databases
Real Application Clusters (RAC) Installation, Administration and Deployment
Data Guard Administration
Oracle Enterprise Manager Cloud Control Installation and Administration.
Backup & Recovery using RMAN and Data Pump.
Oracle WebLogic Server and Oracle Fusion Middleware (Forms & Reports) Installation, Administration and Deployment.
Oracle OVM Server and Manager Virtualization Administration.Skills
Skills:
Database Management: Proficiency in managing and administering Oracle database environments, including installation, configuration, upgrades, and patching.
Performance Tuning: Ability to monitor and optimize database performance using tools like Oracle Enterprise Manager and SQL Tuning Advisor.
Backup and Recovery: Expertise in implementing and managing database backup and recovery strategies to ensure data integrity and availability.
Security Management: Knowledge of database security best practices, including user management, role-based access control, and data encryption.
SQL and PL/SQL: Strong command of SQL (Structured Query Language) and PL/SQL for querying, data manipulation, and stored procedures.
High Availability: Experience with configuring and managing Oracle's high availability solutions, such as Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) and Data Guard.
Data Migration and Integration: Skill in migrating data between databases and integrating Oracle databases with other systems.
Troubleshooting: Ability to diagnose and resolve database issues, errors, and anomalies in a timely manner.
